title: Monthly Business Survey - Construction and Allied Trades

sections.title: How to complete and reporting period

groups.title: How to complete and reporting period

content.description:
Important notice - changes to guidance

New information has been added about which trades are included in the survey and how to calculate value of work. For further guidance, read the introductory pages and guidance that accompanies the questions.

Coronavirus (COVID-19) additional guidance

Please still complete this survey even if your business has been closed.

If you have closed for all, or some, of the period: select "yes, you can provide figures" and enter value of work, even if this is "0".

Exclude from figures: any COVID-19 government subsidies such as the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme and sector-specific or small business grants.

Include: furloughed employees in any employment figures

Explain figures in the comments section to minimise us contacting you and to help us tell an industry story.

list: Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland and Wales but excludes Northern Ireland.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.
Your business has been selected from a list of businesses in the UK that are registered for VAT, PAYE or with Companies House.
You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
installation of electrical, plumbing, heat and air conditioning

content.description: A full list of allied trades can be found here

This section asks for a total figure for the value of the work your business has carried out during the reporting period. Value of work refers to a precise valuation or informed estimates of chargeable work carried out during the reporting period. This includes work started, work in progress and work completed.
This section asks for information on the value of new builds and repair and maintenance, improvements and major alterations on housing for public and private sector projects.
This section asks for information on the value of new infrastructure, and repair and maintenance of existing infrastructure.

This section asks for information on the value of non-housing work, excluding infrastructure, carried out on new structures for public, commercial and industrial projects, and repair and maintenance of existing structures.
This section asks for information on the number of employees and hours worked split by gender.
Please provide any additional comments about your data.
My figures have changed due to:

list: The information you provide contributes to Gross Domestic Product (GDP). The Monthly Business Survey figures are published monthly in the Output in the Construction Industry Statistical Bulletin.

blocks.title: How to complete this survey
blocks.description:
• This survey is for construction businesses and allied trades. If you are a fitter, installer, or have any other involvement in construction projects, you are included within the construction industry and so should report your figures. A full list of allied trades can be found here.
  • If you have not carried out any work in the reporting period, enter zero values and still submit. Nil returns are equally important in producing statistics.
  • If your total value of work is zero, please explain in the comments section at the end of the survey. This will reduce the need for us to contact you with data queries.

What you need to do

You will be asked to provide a total figure for the value of the work your business has carried out during the reporting period.

You will then be asked to provide values for the work you have carried out across three main categories, with other breakdowns in each section.

  • Housing work
  • Infrastructure
  • Non-housing, excluding infrastructure

If you have difficulty in splitting your work across the different categories, then an informed estimate is acceptable. However, please use a consistent approach for each reporting period.

See here for more detail on the questions you will be asked

What do we mean by "value of work"?

To calculate the value of your work, you will need to provide a precise valuation, or informed estimate if needed, of the chargeable work your business has carried out during the reporting period. This could be work started, in progress, or completed.

To produce a valuation, you will need to:

Include:

  • materials used
  • overheads
  • profits
  • labour costs of employees on your payroll

Exclude:

  • value of the work carried out by subcontractors
  • VAT
  • payments for work carried out in previous periods
  • payments made to consultants or architects
  • fixtures, equipment, tools and materials your business made for sale
  • value of land

questions.title: Are you able to report for the calendar month {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}?

options.label: Yes, I can report for this period

values: Yes, I can report for this period

questions.title: What dates will you be reporting for?
questions.description: If applicable, ensure dates follow on from previous submission. If you need to provide different dates, please explain in the comments box at the end of the survey.

blocks.title: This survey requires you to report the value of work
blocks.description:
Value of work refers to a precise valuation or informed estimate of chargeable work carried out during the reporting period. This includes work started, work in progress and work completed.

Include:

  • work done by your own business on its own business premises
  • fixtures, equipment and tools your business made and used in construction
  • materials your business used, overheads and profits
  • labour costs on your payroll

Exclude:

  • value of work done by subcontractors
  • VAT
  • payments for work carried out in previous periods
  • payments made to consultants or architects
  • fixtures, equipment, tools and materials your business made for sale
  • value of land

content.description: This refers to all work on new structures and repair and maintenance on existing structures, carried out on housing, infrastructure, commercial and industrial projects for the public and private sector.

blocks.title: Housing work
blocks.description:
This section asks for information on the value of work on housing for public and private sector projects including:

  • new builds
  • repair and maintenance, improvements and major alterations

You will be asked to provide information on the value of the work undertaken by your business. Value of work refers to precise valuations or informed estimates of chargeable work carried out during the reporting period. This includes work started, in progress, or completed.

Include:

  • work done by your own business on its own business premises
  • fixtures, equipment and tools your business made and used in construction
  • materials your business used, overheads and profits
  • labour costs on your payroll

Exclude:

  • value of work done by subcontractors
  • VAT
  • payments for work carried out in previous periods
  • payments made to consultants or architects
  • fixtures, equipment, tools and materials your business made for sale
  • value of land

This section asks for information on the value of work on new infrastructure, and repair and maintenance of existing infrastructure.

You will be asked to provide information on the value of the work undertaken by your business. Value of work refers to precise valuations or informed estimates of chargeable work carried out during the reporting period. This includes work started, in progress, or completed.

Include:

  • work done by your own business on its own business premises
  • fixtures, equipment and tools your business made and used in construction
  • materials your business used, overheads and profits
  • labour costs on your payroll

Exclude:

  • value of work done by subcontractors
  • VAT
  • payments for work carried out in previous periods
  • payments made to consultants or architects
  • fixtures, equipment, tools and materials your business made for sale
  • value of land

blocks.title: Non-housing, excluding infrastructure
blocks.description:
This section asks for information on the value of work on non-housing structures, excluding infrastructure for public, commercial and industrial projects including:

  • work on new non-housing structures
  • repair and maintenance of existing non-housing structures

Make sure to exclude infrastructure projects

You will be asked to provide information on the value of the work undertaken by your business. Value of work refers to precise valuations or informed estimates of chargeable work carried out during the reporting period. This includes work started, in progress, or completed.

Include:

  • work on buildings which you hope to sell later for profit
  • work done by your business on its own premises
  • fixtures, equipment and tools your business made and used in construction
  • materials your business used, overheads and profits
  • labour costs on your payroll

Exclude:

  • value of work done by subcontractors
  • VAT
  • payments for work carried out in previous periods
  • payments made to consultants or architects
  • fixtures, equipment, tools and materials your business made for sale
  • value of land

blocks.title: Employment
blocks.description:
This section asks for information on the number of employees, and hours worked split by gender.

Include:

  • all workers paid directly from this business’s payroll(s)
  • those temporarily absent but still being paid, for example on maternity leave

Exclude:

  • subcontractors
  • agency workers paid directly from the agency payroll
  • voluntary workers
  • former employees only receiving a pension
  • self-employed workers
  • working owners who are not paid via PAYE

questions.title: On {{ metadata['employment_date'] | format_date }}, what was the number of employees for {{ metadata['trad_as'] }}?
questions.description: An employee is anyone aged 16 years or over that your organisation directly pays from its payroll(s), in return for carrying out a full-time or part-time job, or being on a training scheme.

list: all workers paid directly from this business’s payroll(s)
those temporarily absent but still being paid, for example on maternity leave
agency workers paid directly from the agency payroll
former employees only receiving a pension
working owners who are not paid via PAYE

questions.title: Please provide any further details that will help us understand your figures and tell an industry story
questions.description:
Explain any changes in your figures from your previous return, or if your total value of work is zero. If you provide comments, we are less likely to contact you with data queries.

You have nearly finished! Make sure you continue to the next page and select 'submit answers' at the bottom

list: sector changes (for example installing a kitchen in a domestic property one month to refurbishing a kitchen in commercial premises another month)

legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
